Detailed Description

Is a drawable object which is able to show an SVG image and allows to modify the view on the fly by commands.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SvgPlayer::SvgPlayer (   ) 
 

Creates an empty SVG player. To fill the player with data invoke SvgPlayer::Load afterwards, which does the loading in a background thread so that the calling application still can receive messages.

SvgPlayer::SvgPlayer (  Control *  parent  ) 
 

Creates an empty SVG player. To fill the player with data invoke SvgPlayer::Load afterwards, which does the loading in a background thread so that the calling application still can receive messages.

Parameters:
parent Parent control where the SVG player is embedded.

SvgPlayer::SvgPlayer (  Control *  parent,
BinData *  p_bindata
) 
 

Creates an SVG player out of the given data. Note that dependant from the complexity of the SVG data the calling application might get blocked for up to 1 second for the loading process. If this is not suitable use the constructor SvgPlayer::SvgPlayer(Control* parent) instead and invoke SvgPlayer::Load afterwards.

Parameters:
parent Parent control where the SVG player is embedded.
p_bindata Pointer to a binary data stream which contains the SVG data. After passing the binary data stream, the stream is obtained by the SVG player and hence automatically released in the destructor of the SVG image.

SvgPlayer::~SvgPlayer (  void   )  [virtual]
 

Destructs SvgPlayer and release all allocated resources

BOOLEAN SvgPlayer::Init (  Control *  parent,
BinData *  data
) 
 

Creates an SVG player out of the given data. Note that dependant from the complexity of the SVG data the calling application might get blocked for up to 1 second for the loading process. If this is not suitable use SvgPlayer::Init(Control* parent) instead and invoke SvgPlayer::Load afterwards.

Parameters:
parent Parent control where the SVG player is embedded.
data Pointer to a binary data stream which contains the SVG data. After passing the binary data stream, the stream is obtained by the SVG player and hence automatically released in the destructor of the SVG image.

void SvgPlayer::Init (  Control *  parent  ) 
 

Creates an empty SVG player. To fill the player with data invoke SvgPlayer::Load afterwards, which does the loading in a background thread so that the calling application still can receive messages.

Parameters:
parent Parent control where the SVG player is embedded.

BOOLEAN SvgPlayer::Load (  BinData *  data  ) 
 

Loads the SVG data into the SVG engine, so that it can be drawn afterwards. The loading is done inside a separate thread, so that the calling application still can receive messages during the loading. This benefit also has some drawbacks: the calling application must take care that it will not delete the SvgPlayer instance during the loading is still active. It is recommended that the calling application disables the current focused control or window when invoking SvgImage::Load:

SvgPlayer* svg_player = new SvgPlayer(&window);
if (svg_player != 0) {
	window.SetDisabled(TRUE);
	if (svg_player->Load(data)) {
		...
	}
	window.SetDisabled(FALSE);
}

Disabling the current focused control or window assures that the user cannot trigger e. g. a Window::OnClose, where the SVG player might get destroyed by the application although the thread still loads the SVG data. If disabling the control is not acceptable, the application itself has to implement an Active Wait mechanism to delay the destruction.

Parameters:
data Pointer to a binary data stream which contains the SVG data. After passing the binary data stream, the stream is obtained by the SVG player and hence automatically released in the destructor of the SVG player.
Returns:
TRUE if the loading has been successful.

BOOLEAN SvgPlayer::Pan (  XYDIM  dx,
XYDIM  dy
) 
 

Pan does panning on the SVG document. Only possible, if IsDocumentPanable() returns TRUE.

Parameters:
dx pan dx pixels horizontal
dy pan dy pixels vertical
Returns:
returns TRUE if panning was successfully.

void SvgPlayer::Play (  UINT32  time = 0  ) 
 

After SvgPlayer::Load() or SvgPlayer::Init(), the SVG document can be played. The decoding is done in a threadlet.

Parameters:
time Starting time, at which the document should be first rendered.

void SvgPlayer::Restart (   ) 
 

Restarts an SVG animation. Time position will be set to 0.

BOOLEAN SvgPlayer::Rotate (  INT16  angle  ) 
 

Rotates the SVG document with given angle.

Parameters:
angle Rotation angle
Returns:
Returns TRUE if rotation is possible, FALSE if not. Use GetErrorCode() to determine more error information.

BOOLEAN SvgPlayer::SetZoomLevel (  INT8  level  ) 
 

SetZoomLevel can be used to zoom into an SVG document. This is only possible, if IsDocumentZoomable() returns TRUE

Parameters:
level zoom level
Returns:
returns TRUE if zooming was successfully.

void SvgPlayer::Stop (   ) 
 

Stops the playback of an SVG animation. This method does not change the time position. Calling Play() will resume at actual time position.
